com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class AbstractContextMenuInputMode<TContextMenu>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.AbstractContextMenuInputMode<TContextMenu>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInputMode
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContextMenuInputMode

    public abstract class AbstractContextMenuInputMode<TContextMenu>
extends Object
implements IInputMode
    An implementation of the IInputMode interface that will display a ContextMenu when the user right clicks on the CanvasControl.

    The methods showMenu, hideMenu(Object) hideMenu} as well as the MenuClosedCallback are used to communicate to this instance whenever the context menu should be opened or closed. The methods isMenuEmpty and clearMenu(Object) are used when the menu is initialized and one can register a callback to the PopulateMenu event to customize the contents of the menu strip depending on the coordinate in the world coordinate system where the menu strip has been opened.

    This mode is Exclusive by default.

      AbstractContextMenuInputMode()
      Creates a new instance with no initial context menu.

    • Method Detail

      • addPopulateMenuListener

        public final void addPopulateMenuListener(IEventHandler<PopulateMenuEventArgs> populateMenuEvent)
        Adds the given listener for the PopulateMenu event that occurs when the context menu is about to be shown.

        Handlers of the event can populate the Menu, set the ShowingMenuRequested and set or respect the Handled property. Note that all handlers will be called, even if one of them sets the Handled property to true. Every handler should query this property and decide carefully what to do.

        Parameters:
        populateMenuEvent - The listener to add.
        See Also:
        removePopulateMenuListener(IEventHandler)

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Makes the menu invisible.
        Specified by:
        cancel in interface IInputMode

      • clearMenu

        protected abstract void clearMenu(TContextMenu menu)
        Clears all items of the given popup menu.

        Subclasses have to implement this method for the given framework specific popup menu instance that has been created by createMenu(). Whenever yFiles framework needs to clear a popup menu and isMenuClearingEnabled() returns true this method for GUI framework specific removal of menu items is called.

        Parameters:
        menu - the framework specific popup menu to remove the items from

      • createMenu

        protected abstract TContextMenu createMenu()
        Creates a new instance of the popup menu.

        Subclasses have to create the framework specific popup menu instance here. The other abstract methods of this class need to be able to handle popup menu instances created by this method.

        Returns:
        a new instance of the popup menu
        See Also:
        showMenu(Object, com.yworks.yfiles.geometry.PointD), hideMenu(Object), clearMenu(Object), isMenuEmpty(Object)

      • createPopulateMenuContext

        protected IInputModeContext createPopulateMenuContext()
        Creates an IInputModeContext for use with the PopulateMenu call in the upcoming query.
        Returns:
        An instance of IInputModeContext.

      • getController

        protected final ConcurrencyController getController()
        Gets the installed ConcurrencyController.
        Returns:
        The Controller.

      • getInputModeContext

        public final IInputModeContext getInputModeContext()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Returns the context instance this mode is currently installed in or null if this instance is not installed.

        Note that this instance should not be passed down to subordinate modes or instances. Instead a corresponding context that has this instance set as the ParentInputMode should be used.

        Specified by:
        getInputModeContext in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The InputModeContext.

      • getMenu

        public final TContextMenu getMenu()
        Gets the menu to show.

        If no menu has been configured with this instance this will create the menu using the createMenu() callback.

        Returns:
        The Menu.
        See Also:
        #setMenu(ContextMenu)

      • getPriority

        public final int getPriority()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Specified by:
        getPriority in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The Priority.

      • getValidMenuLocationHitTestable

        public final IHitTestable getValidMenuLocationHitTestable()
        Gets an IHitTestable that determines whether it is valid to open a context menu at the queried position.

        If the instance yields false #onMenuOpening(ContextMenu, PointD, EventSource) will not be queried and the context menu will not be shown. By default there is a hit testable instance that always yields true.

        Returns:
        The ValidMenuLocationHitTestable.
        See Also:
        setValidMenuLocationHitTestable(IHitTestable)

      • hideMenu

        protected abstract void hideMenu(TContextMenu menu)
        Hides the given popup menu.

        Subclasses have to implement this method for the given framework specific popup menu instance that has been created by createMenu(). Whenever yFiles framework needs to hide a popup menu this method for GUI framework specific hiding of popup menus is called.

        Parameters:
        menu - the framework specific popup menu to hide

      • install

        public void install(IInputModeContext context,
                    ConcurrencyController controller)
        Installs this mode in the canvas.
        Specified by:
        install in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context to install this mode into.
        controller - The Controller for this mode.
        See Also:
        IInputMode.uninstall(IInputModeContext)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Gets the enabled state of this input mode.

        Clients can use this property to disable or reenable this instance. This will set the Enabled property of the installed Controller so a disabled instance should never try to acquire the input mutex.

        Returns:
        The Enabled.
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • isExclusive

        public final boolean isExclusive()
        Gets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        Returns:
        The Exclusive.
        See Also:
        setExclusive(boolean)

      • isMenuClearingEnabled

        public final boolean isMenuClearingEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether to clear Menu's items before the PopulateMenu event is triggered.
        Returns:
        true (the default value) if the context menu should be cleared before the query; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setMenuClearingEnabled(boolean)

      • isMenuEmpty

        protected abstract boolean isMenuEmpty(TContextMenu menu)
        Indicates whether the given popup menu does not have any items.

        Subclasses have to implement this method for the given framework specific popup menu instance that has been created by createMenu(). Whenever yFiles input framework needs to know if a popup menu does not have any items this method for GUI framework specific query is called.

        Parameters:
        menu - the framework specific popup menu to to check for items
        Returns:
        true if the given popup menu does not have any items; false otherwise

      • onCanceled

        protected void onCanceled()
        Called after cancel() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been canceled.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • onConcurrencyControllerActivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerActivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to true.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been activated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

      • onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to false.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been deactivated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

      • onPopulateMenu

        protected void onPopulateMenu(PopulateMenuEventArgs args)
        Raises the PopulateMenu event.
        Parameters:
        args - The PopulateMenuEventArgs instance containing the event data.

      • onPopulateMenu

        protected boolean onPopulateMenu(TContextMenu menu,
                                 PointD location,
                                 EventSource eventSource)
        This will populate the context menu for the given world coordinate.

        This implementation will trigger the PopulateMenu event and will use the ShowingMenuRequested value as the return value. If the event will not be handled, this method will return true if the menu already contains elements.

        Parameters:
        menu - The menu to optionally populate with items.
        location - The location in the world coordinate system for which the context menu has been invoked.
        eventSource - The source of the context menu event.
        Returns:
        Whether to show the context menu.

      • onStopped

        protected void onStopped()
        Called after stop() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been stopped.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • removePopulateMenuListener

        public final void removePopulateMenuListener(IEventHandler<PopulateMenuEventArgs> populateMenuEvent)
        Removes the given listener for the PopulateMenu event that occurs when the context menu is about to be shown.

        Handlers of the event can populate the Menu, set the ShowingMenuRequested and set or respect the Handled property. Note that all handlers will be called, even if one of them sets the Handled property to true. Every handler should query this property and decide carefully what to do.

        Parameters:
        populateMenuEvent - The listener to remove.
        See Also:
        addPopulateMenuListener(IEventHandler)

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets the enabled state of this input mode.

        Clients can use this property to disable or reenable this instance. This will set the Enabled property of the installed Controller so a disabled instance should never try to acquire the input mutex.

        Parameters:
        value - The Enabled to set.
        See Also:
        isEnabled()

      • setExclusive

        public final void setExclusive(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        Parameters:
        value - The Exclusive to set.
        See Also:
        isExclusive()

      • setMenu

        public final void setMenu(TContextMenu value)
        Sets the menu to show.

        If no menu has been configured with this instance this will create the menu using the createMenu() callback.

        Parameters:
        value - The Menu to set.
        See Also:
        getMenu()

      • setMenuClearingEnabled

        public final void setMenuClearingEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether to clear Menu's Items before the PopulateMenu event is triggered.
        Parameters:
        value - true (the default value) if the context menu should be cleared before the query; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isMenuClearingEnabled()

      • setMenuClosedCallback

        protected abstract void setMenuClosedCallback(TContextMenu menu,
                                              Runnable menuClosedCallback)
        Defines or removes a function to be called when the given popup menu has been closed.

        Subclasses have to implement this method for the given framework specific popup menu instance that has been created by createMenu(). The yFiles framework calls this method to define a function that should be called when the given popup menu has been closed. If the menuClosedCallback is null, then a former defined function should no longer be called.

        Parameters:
        menu - the framework specific popup menu to set the callback for
        menuClosedCallback - the function to be called when the popup menu has been closed or null if a former defined function should no longer be called.

      • setPriority

        public final void setPriority(int value)
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Parameters:
        value - The Priority to set.
        See Also:
        getPriority()

      • setValidMenuLocationHitTestable

        public final void setValidMenuLocationHitTestable(IHitTestable value)
        Sets an IHitTestable that determines whether it is valid to open a context menu at the queried position.

        If the instance yields false #onMenuOpening(ContextMenu, PointD, EventSource) will not be queried and the context menu will not be shown. By default there is a hit testable instance that always yields true.

        Parameters:
        value - The ValidMenuLocationHitTestable to set.
        See Also:
        getValidMenuLocationHitTestable()

      • showMenu

        protected abstract void showMenu(TContextMenu menu,
                                 PointD viewLocation)
        Shows the given popup menu at the given location in view coordinates.

        Subclasses have to implement this method for the given framework specific popup menu instance that has been created by createMenu(). Whenever yFiles framework requires a popup menu this method for GUI framework specific display of popup menus is called.

        Parameters:
        menu - the framework specific popup menu to show
        viewLocation - the location in view coordinates where to show the popup menu

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Makes the menu invisible.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        base.Stop()
        See Also:
        IInputMode.cancel()

        public void uninstall(IInputModeContext context)
        Removes the menu from the context and replaces it with the old instance.
        Specified by:
        uninstall in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context to uninstall this mode from.
